intro: Verbascum ledermannii, commonly known as the desert mullein, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Verbascum ledermannii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
